message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with decoding of error-correcting codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The specific codes being considered are Reed-Muller codes, which are a type of linear error-correcting code (cs.CC). The paper also discusses the use of permutation techniques, which are commonly used in algorithms for data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The use of posterior probabilities and elimination of error-prone information bits suggests a focus on statistical inference (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses simulation results, which could fall under the category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI) if the simulations were performed on a networked system.
